data.name: Simple Caesar Cipher
data.description:
The Caesar Cipher is a classic encryption method that was used by Julius Caesar to protect messages to his military. 
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caesar_cipher

1. Each letter is converted to a number, e.g. `A = 1, B = 2`.

      `APPLE = 1, 13, 13, 9, 5`

2. A 'shift' is then applied to the number. For this example, a shift of `1` is applied to the converted 'APPLE'.

      `2, 14, 14, 10, 6`

3. This set of numbers is then converted back to letters to reveal an encoded message.

      `2, 14, 14, 10, 6 = BQQMF`
      
      
Note: In this Kata, the shift is set to -1 by default.

Create a function which can be used to decipher a message (such as BQQMF) to reveal the original message (APPLE).
